intro: Dendrobium uncinatum, commonly known as the hook-leaf orchid, is a tropical epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia. It features a sympodial growth habit with upright, wiry stems that often bear clusters of fleshy, elliptical pseudobulbs. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white, yellow, and pink, typically arranged in racemes along the stems.
